text: فتقطعوا۟ امرهم بينهم زبرا كل حزبۭ بما لديهم فرحون

translations.translation: But they disagreed and split up, dividing into sects, each party exulting in what it had.
But then they divided up their order into different creeds, each section rejoicing in what it had come to have.
But people later cut up their religion into bits, each group rejoicing in what they have.
The people divided themselves into many sects, each with their own book and each happy with whatever they had.
But their nations broke their tasks into pieces; every group happy with what it has.
But they have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in what is with it.
But they cut off their religion among themselves into sects, each part rejoicing in that which is with them.
But they split in their affair between them into sects, each party rejoicing in what is with them.
But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its tenets.
Yet they divided themselves into factions, each rejoicing in what they had.
Then they cut their affair among them in regard to the Scriptures: each band in that which is with them rejoicing.
But they fragmented their religion among themselves, each party boasting about what it had.
But people have cut off their affair (of unity), between them, into sects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.
But they (men) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its belief.
Yet they have split their affairs between themselves into sects, each rejoicing in what it has.
But they tore themselves into sects; each party happy with what they have.
But the people divided their religion among them into sects - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.

[23:53] But they, the followers, split into sects regarding their affair, their religion (zuburan, ‘sects’, is a circumstantial qualifier of the subject of the verb taqatta‘ū, ‘they split’), in other words, [they became] opposing parties, the likes of the Jews and the Christians and others, each party rejoicing in, exultant with, what they had, that is, with the religion they had.

(But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects) so they split among themselves with regard to religion into different groups: groups of Jews, Christians, idolaters and Magians, (each sect) the adherents of each religion and sect (rejoicing in its tenets) being impressed with what they have.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُراً } معناه قِطعٌ
 وزُبَرٌ معناه قِطعةٌ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: ومع ذلك { فَتَقَطَّعُوۤاْ أَمْرَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ } أي: دينهم الواحد وملتهم الواحدة { زُبُراً } قِطعاً مختلفةً وأحزاباً متفاوتةً ومِلَلاً متخالفةً، يدعي كل منهم حقية دينه وملته، فصار { كُلُّ حِزْبٍ } منهم { بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ } من الدين والملة { فَرِحُونَ } [المؤمنون: 53] مسرورون معجَبون

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
ثم قال تعالى: { فتقطَّعوا أمرهم } أي: فتفرقوا في أمر دينهم مع اتحاده، وجعلوه قطعاً متفرقة، وأدياناً مختلفة، { بينهم زُبراً } أي: قطعاً - جمع زَبور، بمعنى الفرقة، ويؤيده قراءة من قرأ: زُبَراً بفتح الباء، جمع زُبْرة كغُرْفة، أي: قطعاً مختلفة، كلٌّ ينتحل كتاباً، وقيل: جمع زَبور، بمعنى كتاب، أي: كل فريق يزعم أن له كتاباً يتمسك به


وعن الحسن: قطعوا كتاب الله قطعاً وحرَّفوه، والأول أقرب، أي: تفرقوا في أصل الدين فرقاً، وتحزبوا أحزاباً، { كل حزب } من أولئك المتحزبين { بما لديهم } من الدين الذي اختاروه، أو من الهوى والرأي، { فَرِحُون }: مُعجبُون، يعتقدون أنه الحق
